page.title: 04CLUNBURY HILL
page.content: { Clunbury hill}is 300 metres above sea level, and it is 1800 metres long. Clunbury hill is rough grazing land. The farmer who owns most of the hill has cultivated some of it because it is rough. He has ploughed it down. Clunbury hill has a fairy stone; we do not know how long it has been there but it is shown on old maps. Some historians now believe that the last battle between{Caradoc}and the {Romans}was on Clunbury hill. There are many disused quarries. Some of the houses in Clunbury are made from stone from the hill. There is a flat run across the top of the hill called the Gallop because horses race across it. There is a great view from the hill. From the top you can see the town of {Church Stretton}which is approximately 15 miles away. There are several natural springs on the hill.
